column4: Can I uninstall something.. or change the settings, through the alt+ctrl+f5 screen?
you can do anything you know how. installation in the command line is done with aptitude or apt-get
do you know what the name of the package is that installed nvidia vga?
this may be the way: run "aptitude search nvidia" in that console window(alt-ctrl-f5), see what results come up with i on the beginning of the lien
I really know nothing about linux.. could you tell me things step by step?

1.hold down alt and ctrl, and press f5. 2. log in with your user name and password. 3. type "aptitude search nvidia", press enter. 4. write down the names of the packages that have the letter "i" on the beginning of their lines. 5. come back here and tell me the names.
I was in the kitchen. I dont know. To install it again, run sudo aptitude install nvidia-glx

prepend messages to me with my nick, I missed that one. again in the place you got those names, type sudo aptitude remove nvidia-glx, press enter, and follow the prompts. It should be uninstalled after that.
in the place you got  those names, type sudo aptitude remove nvidia-glx, press enter, and follow the prompts. It should  be uninstalled after that.
now, I don't have an interface anymore, how can I fix that? >.>
what interface? you mean the graphical user interface?
well, I am not sure. Try typing "sudo invoke-rc.d gdm restart" in that same place, and then press enter. I am going to use run "" instead of type "" and press enter from now on in our conversation.
I may need to install the nvidia thing again.
because it gave me a message saying "Failed to start the X server (your graphical interface)." and stuff..
for some reason, my laptop seems to be unable to view the interface, as soon as I get to the login screen, I get a black screen instead.
